Travis AFB: Phoenix Spark Cell for Innovation

“If in peacetime we tell every Airman how to do everything, how can we possibly expect, in wartime, we will suddenly be able to take the initiative and prevail in highly contested combat?” –Secretary Heather Wilson

Join US

Innovations by the Warfighter, for the Warfighter

In January 2016, leaders at Travis Air Force Base (AFB) issued a grand challenge: how do we leverage our Airmen’s ingenuity and the technical expertise in Silicon Valley to bring tomorrow’s capabilities to the Warfighter today? From this challenge, the Travis AFB Innovation Office was formed- a volunteer group that connects the military's operational experts with industry and academia's problem-solvers. These partnerships bolstered innovation efforts within the Air Force, created a forum to solve base-level capability gaps, and allowed for the discovery of previously unknown opportunities. Ultimately, it enhanced mission effectiveness across the enterprise.

The Travis AFB Innovation Office fostered a grassroots movement which incorporated operational experts into the design and development processes. Through an iterative solution framework, they were able to agiley respond to the Warfighters' needs. This model gained the attention of the Air Mobility Command (AMC) commander. In April of 2017, the AMC commander chartered Phoenix Spark- an intiative to further grassroots innovation. As the inaugural Phoenix Spark Cell, Travis AFB is the role model for future Spark programs. By continuously learning as an organization, inspiring a culture of innovation, and empowering Airmen to lead at every level, Phoenix Spark is delivering tomorrow’s innovative capabilities to the warfighter today.

Technological Solutions

Implementing advances in 3D-Printing, Robotics, and Data Analysis; Positioning the Air Force at the cutting edge of technology.

Operational Research

Encouraging experimentation and embracing failure as learning opportunities; Expanding the boundaries of what is possible.

Cross-Industry Collaboration

Building relationships with private and public organizations; Learning and growing through these partnerships.

Educational Opportunities

Enhancing the knowledge of each Airman; Providing the capability to overcome challenges as they arise on the frontline.
